A family (x_i)_{i in I} of elements of an A-module M is called free or linearly independent if from an equation sum_{i in I} a_i x_i = 0 with coefficients a_i in A we can conclude that a_i = 0 for all i in I. A free system of generators will also be referred to as a basis.
The rank of an A-module M is defined as the supremum of all numbers n such that there exists a linearly independent system of elements x_1, ..., x_n in M.
Does the concept of a/an Free system of generators (basis) need to be defined for a definition of a/an Rank of an A-module to make sense? (True if the first concept is needed and False if is not.)

Explanation:
To determine if the concept of a free system of generators (basis) is necessary for defining the rank of an A-module, we need to analyze the definitions provided:

1. The rank of an A-module M is defined as the supremum of all numbers n such that there exists a linearly independent system of elements x_1, ..., x_n in M. This definition focuses on the existence of a linearly independent set of elements in M, but it does not explicitly require that these elements form a basis or a free system of generators.

2. A free system of generators (basis) is defined as a family of elements of an A-module M that is linearly independent and spans M. This definition includes the condition of linear independence as well as the additional requirement that the set spans M.

From these definitions, we see that the concept of rank relies solely on the existence of linearly independent sets, not necessarily on these sets forming a basis or spanning M. Therefore, the concept of a free system of generators (basis) is not strictly necessary for the definition of rank, as rank only requires the existence of linearly independent sets, irrespective of whether they span M or not.
